task.title: Configuring TLS for the MME
task.shortdesc: Use the liconf liCAcert, liconf liTlsCertificate, and liconf liTlsClientCert commands to configure TLS.

taskbody.prereq: The TLS configuration data (for example, certificates and profiles) are loaded when link is created by the liconf lic create command. Live update of the configuration is not supported. To update the TLS configuration the current link needs to be deleted with liconf lic delete command and recreated once the new TLS configuration is in place. Wait about five minutes before recreating the TLS configuration using the liconf lic create command.

stepxmp.codeblock: liconf liTlsCertificate create --name X12Cert1 --privateKeyFile='/home/cmm/server1.cmm.key' --signedCertFile='/home/cmm/server1.cmm.crt' liconf liTlsClientCert create --name X12Cert1 --privateKeyFile='/home/cmm/server1.cmm.key' --signedCertFile='/home/cmm/server1.cmm.crt'

step.cmd: Create the LI TLS CA certificate.

stepxmp.codeblock: liconf liTlsCAcert create –name cacert1 –signedCertFile=/home/cmm/rootCA1.crt liconf liTlsCAcert create –name cacert2 --signedCertFile=/home/cmm/intermediateCA1.crt

liconf liTlsProfile create --name X1serverProf1 –tlsCertificateName X12Cert1 --liTlsEncrypted true --liTlsVersion 1.2 liconf liTlsProfile create --name X2clientProf1 –tlsCertificateName X12Cert1 --liTlsEncrypted true --liTlsVersion 1.2

step.cmd: Associate the TLS profile of X1_1 links.

stepxmp.codeph: liconf lic create --licIndex 1 --licId 2 --licIp 170.16.49.81 --licSpec LIPv2 --adminState unlocked --liTlsProfileName X1serverProf1 --lieAct true

step.cmd: Associate the TLS profile of X2 links.
Associate the TLS profile of X2 links to the LIC ID.
